isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - "SOLID STATE" GLOW PLUG ANALYSIS GUIDE

lev1.title: Description and Operation
lev1.para: The glow plug controller assembly incorporates all control functions and the power relay in one "solid state" electronic module which is engine mounted on the rear of the intake manifold, Figure 6.1.

The "Solid State" Glow Plug System uses positive temperature coefficient (PTC) glow plugs with push-on "bullet" terminals. The glow plugs change resistance with temperature and the controller senses the change in resistance to control the glow plug cycle time. Refer to Figure 6.2.
The wiring harness used on the "solid state" system must be routed as shown in Figure 6.1.

figure.caption: Figure 6.1 Top View of 7.3 Liter Engine [1988 Model Year and before shown]

lev1.para: The "Solid State" system determines the glow plug temperature and maintains the temperature regardless of ambient conditions by electronically measuring the resistance of the glow plugs. The power to the system is actuated when the ignition switch is turned on. A wait light indicates when the glow plugs have reached proper temperature by going out. An after glow operation of the glow plugs continues after the wait light has been turned off. This cyclic operation of the glow plugs reduces white "start-up" smoke. The after glow can be determined by listening to the relay cycle on and off. (A rapid "clicking" sound will be heard [with hood open] during after glow cycling).

A special feature of the "Solid State" Glow Plug System is its instant recycle ability. If the switch is turned off, the operator can immediately recycle by turning the ignition on, which will start the reheat cycle of the glow plugs and the wait light will come on. Engine cranking can begin as soon as the wait light goes out.

The power relay is located above the controller and the entire unit is covered by a plastic protective cover. The cover prevents accidental contact of the large resistor or relay parts during the operation of the system. If batteries are low, jump starting should be accomplished by connecting to the normal battery terminals, not the power relay.

important.para: DO NOT JUMP START BY CONNECTING POWER LEADS TO THE CONTROLLER MOUNTED RELAY. DOING SO WILL RESULT IN GLOW PLUG FAILURE. THE CONTROLLER IS SERVICED ONLY AS AN ASSEMBLY.
